results.title: Mummy, daddy Lenin and Mao
results.creator_credit: Dick Foster, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Urie Bronfenbrenner considers the changes that are taking place in the traditional roles of men and women both in the family and in the world at large.

results.title: Goals for the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Considers such topics as family breakdown, violence and vandalism, and alienation in youth.

results.title: A Child's place
results.creator_credit: Dick Foster, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
Looks at the system of daycare for young children in Israel, USSR, China and Sweden.The film asks “Where are the children? Who are they with? and what are they doing?”.

results.title: Bronze boy
results.creator_credit: David Sims, David H. Fowler, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 228 of Series “Parade”.
A step-by-step record of the creation in 1969 of a life-sized statue of “Young Nick”, a cabin boy on Captain Cook’s ship “Endeavour”. The sculptor, Auckland’s Frank Szirmay, speaks about his work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Sims, David H. Fowler, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: A Bear in hot water
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington takes his first bath at the Brown’s and makes a terrible mess with soap and water. Based on a chapter of the Michael Bond story “A Bear called Paddington”.

results.title: A Visit to the hospital
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington Bear at large in a hospital fails to find Mr Curry, the patient, but gets to see a psychiatrist instead. Amusing word association games follow. Animated by Ivor Wood. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.description:

results.title: Paddington turns detective
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington receives a torch from Mr Gruber as a gift and receives an answer to his morse code signals from Mr. Brown’s greenhouse! He assumes the identity of Feathers Locke, Detective and proceeds to investigate, even fingerprinting Mr. Brown’s prize marrow! Adapted from Michael Bond’s book ‘More about Paddington’. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Music by Herbert Chappel.
